types1:Item.types1:Name: IICS_REST_API
types1:Item.types1:Description: This service defines actions to connect to IICS through REST API

businessConnector.name: IICS_REST_API
businessConnector.description: This service defines actions to connect to IICS through REST API

action.label: PublicCoreV3ExportPost
action.name: PublicCoreV3ExportPost
action.description: Start Export Job. #### POST Request: To start the export job, use the following URI: public/core/v3/export Include the following fields in the request: | Field | Type | Required | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | name | String | No | Name of the export job. If a name is not specified, the default name will be used in the following format: job-<currentTimeInMilliseconds> | | objects | Collection < Complex type > | Yes | Object IDs for objects to export. | | id | String | Yes | Include in objects object.Global ID for the export object. This can be a project, folder, or asset ID. | #### POST Response: If successful, returns the following information for the export job: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | jobId | String | ID of the export job. | | createTime | String | Time export package was created. | | updateTime | String | Time export package was last updated. | | name | String | Name of the import job. | | startTime | String | Time the export job was started. | | endTime | String | Time the export job ended. | | status | Complex type | Status of the export. | | state | String | Returned in status object.Status of the export job, such as In Progress, Success, or Failed. | | message | String | Returned in status object.Export job status message. | | objects | Collection | Collection of objects. Returns null if blank. |

action.label: PublicCoreV3ImportIdGet
action.name: PublicCoreV3ImportIdGet
action.description: Start Import Job. Use a POST request to specify and start an import job. #### POST Request: To specify the import objects and start the import job, use the following URI: /public/core/v3/import/<id> The <id> is the import job ID received in the POST response for the import package upload. Include the following fields in the request: | Field | Type | Required | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | name | String | No | Name of the Import job. If a name is not specified, the default name will be used in the following format: job-<currentTimeInMilliseconds> | | importSpecification| Collection < Complex type > | No | Used to specify import specifications. If not specified, then the import includes all objects in the import package with default conflict resolution settings. | | defaultConflictResolution | String | No | Include in the importSpecification object. Whether to overwrite existing assets with the assets in the import file. Includes the following options:| | defaultConflictResolution | --- | --- | OVERWRITE. Overwrite the existing asset with the asset in the import file. | | defaultConflictResolution| --- | --- | REUSE. Do not import the asset. Note: The import includes connections and runtime environments associated with the assets if they do not exist in the target organization. | | includeObjects | Collection < Complex type > | No | Include in the importSpecification object. Objects to include in the import. If this field is not specified, then the import includes all objects in the import package. If the specified object is a project, then the import includes all assets that belong to the project and all dependent objects that are not already present in the target organization. If the specified object is an asset, the import creates the asset's containers (project, folder) if they do not already exist. | | objectSpecification | Collection < Complex type > | No | Include in the importSpecification object. Specifies the object properties. If properties are not specified for a particular object, then the import uses the default conflict resolution settings. | | sourceObjectGuid | String | Yes | Include in the objectSpecification object. The object ID in the export package file. Mandatory if objectSpecification is present. | | conflictResolution | String | No | Include in the importSpecification object. Whether to overwrite existing assets with the assets in the import file. Includes the following options:| | | | | OVERWRITE. Overwrite the existing asset with the asset in the import file. | | | | | REUSE. Do not import the asset. Note: The import includes connections and runtime environments associated with the assets if they do not exist in the target organization. | | targetObjectId | String | No | Include in the objectSpecification object.Used for Container to Container mapping, as well as some asset to asset mappings.Supported for GA: connection, runtime environment and projects. | #### POST Response: If successful, returns the following information for the import job: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | jobId | String | ID of the import job. | | createTime | String | Time import package was created. | | updateTime | String | Time import package was last updated. | | name | String | Name of the import job. | | startTime | String | Time the import job was started. | | endTime | String | Time the import job ended. | | status | Complex type | Status of the package upload. | | state | String | Returned in the status object. Import state of the individual object, such as IN PROGRESS, SUCCESS, or FAILED. | | message | String | Returned in status object.Import job status message. | | objects | Collection | Objects included in the import job. | | sourceOrgId | String | Organization ID of the organization that created the export package that was imported. |

action.label: PublicCoreV3LookupPost
action.name: PublicCoreV3LookupPost
action.description: Look up. #### POST Request: This resource is usually used to obtain an object's ID to use in an export request. When you use this resource to obtain an object's ID, the lookup resource uses the object path and type to perform the lookup. To request lookup information, use the following URI: /public/core/v3/lookup You can use the following fields in the objects object: | Field | Type | Required | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | id | String | Required if object path and type not included | Global identifier of the object. | | path | String | Required with type if object ID not included | Full path of the object including project, folder, and object name | | type | String | Required with path if object ID not included | Type of object. Can be one of the following types: - DTEMPLATE - MTT - DSS - DMASK - DRS - Connection - AGENT - AgentGroup - MAPPLET - BSERVICE - HSCHEMA - PCS - FWCONFIG - CustomSource - MI_TASK - WORKFLOW - VISIOTEMPLATE - SCHEDULE - SCHEDULE_JOB - SCHEDULE_BLACKOUT - TASKFLOW Object types are not case sensitive. | ####POST Response: Returns the object if successful or an error object if errors occur.

action.label: PublicCoreV3ExportIdGet
action.name: PublicCoreV3ExportIdGet
action.description: Get Export Job Status. Use a GET request to get the status of an export job. To obtain status of the export job, use one of the following URIs: + To receive status of the export job, use the following URI: public/core/v3/export/<id> + To receive status for each object in the export job, use the following URI: public/core/v3/export/<id>?expand=objects The <id> is the export job ID. Continue polling the request until the state is SUCCESSFUL. #### GET Response: Returns the following export status information: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | id | String | ID of the export job. | | createTime | String | Time export package was created. | | updateTime | String | Time export package was last updated. | | name | String | Name of the export job. | | startTime | String | Time the export job was started. | | endTime | String | Time the export job ended. | | status | Complex type | Status of the export. | | state | String | ned in status object.Status of the export job, such as In Progress, Success, or Failed. | | message | String | Returned in status object.Export job status message. | | id | String | Returned in objects object. Global ID of the export object requested. | | name | String | Returned in objects object. Name of the object to export. | | path | String | Returned in objects object. Complete path of the object to export.| | description | String | Returned in objects object. Description of the object to export. | | status | Complex type | Returned in objects object. Export status of the individual object. | | state | String | Returned in status object. Export state of the individual object, such as IN PROGRESS, SUCCESS, or FAILED. | | message | String | Returned in status object. Export status message for the individual object. |

action.label: PublicCoreV3ImportPackagePost
action.name: PublicCoreV3ImportPackagePost
action.description: Upload Import Package. Use a POST request to upload an import package. #### POST Request: To upload the import package, use the following URI: /public/core/v3/import/package For Content-Type, use multipart/form-data In the request, include the part name and content, for example: Part Name: "package" Content: package zip file stream #### POST Response: If successful, returns the following information for the import job: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | jobId | String | ID of the import job. | | jobStatus | Collection | Status of the package upload. | | state | String | Returned in the status object.Status of the import job, such as In Progress, Success, or Failed. | | message | String | Returned in the status object. Import job status message. |

action.label: PublicCoreV3ImportIdExpandObjectsGet
action.name: PublicCoreV3ImportIdExpandObjectsGet
action.description: Get Import Job Status. Use a GET request to get the status of an import job. #### GET Request: To obtain status of the import job, use one of the following URIs: + To receive status of the import job, use the following URI: /public/core/v3/import/<id> + To receive status for each object in the import job, use the following URI: /public/core/v3/import/<id>?expand=objects The <id> is the import job ID. #### GET Response: Returns the following import status information: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | id | String | ID of the import job. | | createTime | String | Time import package was created. | | updateTime | String | Time import package was last updated. | | name | String | Name of the import job. | | startTime | String | Time the import job was started. | | endTime | String | Time the import job ended. | | status | Complex type | Status of the package upload. | | state | String | Returned in the status object. Status of the import job, such as IN PROGRESS, SUCCESS, or FAILED. | | message | String | Returned in status object.import job status message. | | sourceOrgId | String | Organization ID of the organization that created the export package that was imported. | | sourceObject | Collection | Returned in objects object. Name of the object to export. | | path | String | Returned in objects object. Complete path of the object to import.| | id | String | Returned in the sourceObject object. Global ID of the object included in the import. | | name | String | Returned in the sourceObject object.Name of the objectincluded in the import. | | type | String | Returned in the sourceObject object.Type of object included in the import. | | description | String | Returned in the sourceObject object. Description of object included in the import. | | targetObject | Collection | Returned in the objects object. Target object. | | id | String | Returned in status object. Export status message for the individual object. | | name | String | Returned in the targetObject object. Name of the target object. | | path | String | Returned in the targetObject object. Complete path of the target object. | | type | String | Returned in the targetObject object. Type of target object. | | description | String | Returned in the targetObject object. Description of target object. | | status | String | Returned in the targetObject object.Status of the target object. | | status | Complex Type | Returned in the objects object. Import status of the individual object. | | state | String | Returned in the status object. Import state of the individual object, such as IN PROGRESS, SUCCESS, or FAILED. | | message | String | Returned in the status object.Import status message for the individual object. |

action.label: PublicCoreV3LicenseOrgOrgIdGet
action.name: PublicCoreV3LicenseOrgOrgIdGet
action.description: License. Use this resource to get license information about organizations and assign licenses to sub-organizations. In order to assign licenses to a sub-organization, you must log in to the parent organization as an administrator. You can use the license resource to send the following requests: + GET request to obtain an organization's editions, custom licenses, and custom limits. + PUT request to update a sub-organization's license information. #### GET Request: To request license information for an organization or sub-organization, use the following URI: public/core/v3/license/org/<orgId> #### GET Reponse: Returns requested license information if successful or an error object if errors occur. If successful, returns the following license information for the specified organization ID: #### GET Example: GET <baseApiUrl>/public/core/v3/license/org/1ax3wad2FEsz35asd2892s #### PUT Request: Use a PUT request to update a sub-organization's license information. In order to update licenses for a sub-organization, you must log in to the parent organization as an administrator. This request overwrites the sub-organization's licenses with the licenses in the request. To make changes to a sub-organization's licenses, first request license information for the sub-organization, make your modifications in the object, and then use it as the request body. To update license information for a sub-organization, use the following URI: public/core/v3/license/org/<orgId>

action.label: PublicCoreV3LicenseOrgOrgIdPut
action.name: PublicCoreV3LicenseOrgOrgIdPut
action.description: License_License. Use this resource to get license information about organizations and assign licenses to sub-organizations. In order to assign licenses to a sub-organization, you must log in to the parent organization as an administrator. You can use the license resource to send the following requests: + GET request to obtain an organization's editions, custom licenses, and custom limits. + PUT request to update a sub-organization's license information. #### GET Request: To request license information for an organization or sub-organization, use the following URI: public/core/v3/license/org/<orgId> #### GET Reponse: Returns requested license information if successful or an error object if errors occur. If successful, returns the following license information for the specified organization ID: #### GET Example: GET <baseApiUrl>/public/core/v3/license/org/1ax3wad2FEsz35asd2892s #### PUT Request: Use a PUT request to update a sub-organization's license information. In order to update licenses for a sub-organization, you must log in to the parent organization as an administrator. This request overwrites the sub-organization's licenses with the licenses in the request. To make changes to a sub-organization's licenses, first request license information for the sub-organization, make your modifications in the object, and then use it as the request body. To update license information for a sub-organization, use the following URI: public/core/v3/license/org/<orgId>

action.label: SaasPublicCoreV3LoginPost
action.name: SaasPublicCoreV3LoginPost
action.description: Login. Use this resource to log in to Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services to use Version 3 REST API resources. Returns a two hour REST API session ID that you can use for subsequent REST API requests. After the session ID expires, log in again to continue working with the REST API. Use the logout resource to end the session #### POST Request: To log into an organization and all REST API sessions for the user in the request body, use the following URL: https://qa-ma.staging1.informaticacloud.com/public/core/api/v3/login Use the following fields in a login object: | Field | Type | Required | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | Username | String | Yes | Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services user name | | Password | String | Yes | Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services password | ####POST Response: Returns the success object if the request is successful. | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | products | Collection | Subscribed Informatica products | | baseApiUrl | String | Returned in the product object. Base API URL for the product | | userInfo | Collection | User information | | sessionId | String | Returned in the userInfo object. REST API session ID for the current session. Use in most REST API request headers | | id | String | Returned in the userInfo object. User ID. | | name | String | User name | | parentOrgId | String | Organization ID for the parent organization | | orgId | String | Returned in the userInfo object. / ID of the organization the user belongs to. / 22 characters. | | orgName | String |Returned in the userInfo object. Organization name. | | groups | Collection | User group information for the use | | status | String | Status of the user | | | | Returns one of the following values: - Active - Inactive | Use the base API URL returned in the response and the session ID for subsequent requests during this session. ####POST Example: To log in to your Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services organization, you might use the following request: POST https://dm-us.informaticacloud.com/saas/public/core/v3/login HTTP/1.0 Content-Type: application/json Accept: application/json

action.label: PublicCoreV3ExportIdPackageGet
action.name: PublicCoreV3ExportIdPackageGet
action.description: Download Export Package. Use a GET request to download an export package. #### GET Request: To download the export package, use the following URI: public/core/v3/export/<id>/package The <id> is the export job ID. #### GET Response: If successful, you receive the .zip stream in the response body and the response type will be application/zip. If unsuccessful, you might receive a response similar to the following example:

action.label: PublicCoreV3LogoutPost
action.name: PublicCoreV3LogoutPost
action.description: Logout. Use this resource to log out of an organization and end the REST API session specified in the request. To log out an organization and end the REST API session, include the Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services session ID in the request header with the following URI: /public/core/v3/logout ####POST Example: To log out of your Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services organization, use the following request: POST <serverURL>/public/core/v3/logout HTTP/1.0 Content-Type: application/json Accept: application/json INFA-SESSION-ID: <sessionId>
